Key Match Events: Pakistan secured a comprehensive 81-run victory against the Netherlands to kickstart their World Cup campaign.
Pakistan were in trouble after falling to 38-3 in the early stages but half-centuries from Saud Shakeel and Muhammad Rizwan saw them recover to post 286 after 49 overs.
Netherlands started brightly in their chase as Bas de Leede and Vikram Singh both reached their half-centuries as part of a 70-run stand.
The Dutch middle order failed to provide support for De Leede who eventually fell for 67, with Scott Edward’s side losing their last 8 wickets for 85 runs as they were bowled out for 205.
Haris Rauf took three wickets, including the final wicket of Van Meekeren, to secure Pakistan's victory.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan captain Babar Azam praised the bowlers for starting well and taking wickets in the middle to put pressure on the Netherlands.
Babar Azam also commended Mohammad Rizwan and Saud Shakeel for their partnership that built momentum for Pakistan.
Netherlands captain Scott Edwards expressed disappointment, noting that they were in a good position at 120-2 but failed to capitalize.
Scott Edwards praised Bas De Leede for his performance in both bowling and batting.
Saud Shakeel, player of the match, expressed satisfaction with his performance and highlighted his focus on being positive and scoring runs for the team.
